    expected_output = "Burrito lovers beware!
Chipotle Mexican Grill's shares tumbled  most in 4 years after the company said it was served with a grand jury subpoena related to a food safety incident at one of its restaurants in California...

Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. said on Wednesday it would temporarily close all its restaurants nationwide for several hours next month to hold an all-staff meeting to discuss food safety and quality control.

pic.twitter.com/W6aZI4CJqR ‚Äî Josh D (@joshdub) August 19, 2015 //platform.twitter.com/widgets.js In response to the backlash, Chipotle released a statement saying that it is taking steps to address customer concerns and improve its business practices.

pic.twitter.com/BwG5eD9JLp ‚Äî Justin Boggs (@JustinBoggs) October 15, 2015 //platform.twitter.com/widgets.js A sign on the door of a Chipotle Mexican Grill restaurant in Seattle says they are closed due to a food safety issue.

*sheds tears*
I'm sure they'll recover from this but wow, what a blow.
#Chipotle pic.twitter.com/3hY8yUH2XK ‚Äî Dave Hinton (@Dave_Hinton) July 13, 2015 And on Twitter, it seemed like customers were still loyal to the brand despite the recent setbacks.
Ugh.
What‚Äôs next, Chipotle?
I'm not sure what's more concerning, fact that they were serving expired food or the fact that there is a guy walking around with a bucket of expired guacamole looking for someone to pawn it off on.

pic.twitter.com/5sKJh8V6QG ‚Äî Dave H (@daveh203) July 18, 2018 According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), there have been over 100 reported cases of food poisoning linked to Chipotle since 2008.

https://t.co/v2FwGyf6L5 pic.twitter.com/mj7bW3gjHl #ChipotleScare November 10, 2015 at 12:05 PM The CDC says that all of the confirmed cases were in people who ate at Chipotle Mexican Grill restaurants in nine states between Oct. 20 and Nov. 8.
